title.value: Stringency of containment and closures on the growth of SARS-CoV-2 in Canada prior to accelerated vaccine roll-out
title.justification: The title clearly indicates the focus of the paper, which is on evaluating the impact of containment and closure measures on the growth of SARS-CoV-2 in Canada before a significant vaccine distribution effort began.
title.quote: Stringency of containment and closures on the growth of SARS-CoV-2 in Canada prior to accelerated vaccine roll-out

extractions.description: This paper examines the relationship between non-pharmaceutical interventions (NPIs) and the growth of SARS-CoV-2 cases in Canada before the country significantly increased vaccine distribution. It assesses whether increased stringency of these interventions directly correlates with reduced case growth across different provinces during two epidemic waves.

type.justification: The study uses empirical data from Canadian provinces to analyze the relationship between NPIs and virus case growth.
type.quote: We conducted an ecological time-series study of daily SARS-CoV-2 case growth in Canada from February 2020 to February 2021.

name.justification: The research focuses on the patterns, causes, and effects of SARS-CoV-2 infections in Canadian provinces, which is within the domain of epidemiology.
name.quote: Throughout 2020, non-pharmaceutical interventions (NPIs) were the primary tools employed by governments and public health agencies to slow the spread of SARS-CoV-2.
